title: 108_hr3514
content: The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 is the short title of this Act. The table of contents for this Act is provided. The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 includes provisions for the disposal and conveyance of various administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania. This Act also addresses the administration of land acquired by the United States and its relation to other conveyance authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, including US Tract 121 and US Tract 896. The Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania includes various tracts such as US Tract 1047, Marienville Ranger District Headquarters, and US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. These tracts range in size from 2.42 acres to 4.90 acres and are depicted on specific maps. The Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller on December 12, 1999, is subject to conveyance under section 5. Property descriptions on maps are the primary descriptions of the lands, with maps deemed definitive unless unavailable. Maps are available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service until lands are disposed of. The maps are available for public inspection in the Office of the Chief of the Forest Service until lands are disposed of. As consideration for land conveyance, the recipient may convey other land or improvements to the Secretary. The Secretary may also accept a cash equalization payment exceeding 25% of the land value. The Secretary may accept a cash equalization payment exceeding 25% of the land value for land conveyance under applicable laws. Preference may be given to public entities agreeing to use the land for public purposes. The Secretary may give preference to public entities for land conveyance under this section, with terms and conditions set by the Secretary. Offers may be rejected if deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. (f) Revocations.--Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary under this section, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. (g) Additional Terms and Conditions.--The Secretary may impose additional terms and conditions to protect the interests of the United States in connection with any conveyance under subsection (a). SEC. 3. Conveyance of Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, Warren County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" serves as the primary description of the lands. The Secretary may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map is the primary description of the lands, and will be available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. Upon conveyance of land by the Secretary under this section, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. Conveyance of Ridgeway Ranger District headquarters in Elk County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, for the Ridgeway Ranger District Headquarters. Ridgeway Township must pay the fair market value for the lands as determined by an appraisal. The Secretary may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township for the Ranger District Headquarters, with payment based on fair market value determined by an appraisal. Maps serve as the primary land description, available for public inspection until disposal. The Secretary may convey land to Ridgeway Township for the Ranger District Headquarters based on fair market value. Upon conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation is revoked. The Secretary may convey the Marienville Ranger Residence in Forest County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. The map description is the definitive reference for lands unless unavailable. Upon land conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land is revoked. SEC. 6. DISPOSITION OF FUNDS. The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales or exchanges under section 2 and consideration received under sections 3(b) and 4(b) into the Sisk Act Fund. These funds can be used for acquiring, constructing, or improving administrative facilities and sites for the Allegheny National Forest, or for acquiring land and interests in land. The Sisk Act Fund can be used for acquiring land and interests in the Allegheny National Forest, with a condition that the acquired lands' market value does not exceed 125 percent of the lands disposed of under the Act. The Secretary of Agriculture manages lands acquired under the Sisk Act in accordance with the Weeks Act and other relevant laws. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest are adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition under this Act. SEC. 8. RELATION TO OTHER CONVEYANCES AUTHORITIES. This Act does not affect the Secretary of Agriculture's other land sale, exchange, or acquisition authorities. Lands approved for disposal under this Act are exempt from certain sections of the United States Code.
